Based on an 8 hour day, the number of hours worked was 55,267 per year. The total number of hours paid was 59,995 per year. Calculate the number of productive FTEs.
Which of the following formulas is used to determine a meal equivalent in a commercial operation?
choices: average dollars spent per patron over a one week period
total sales divided by budgeted cost per meal
total revenues for a specific period divided by the cost of a prototype meal

q: The kitchen layout below is characteristic of which foodservice system? Deck ovens / Range / Tilting skillet / Refrigerator / Freezer / Preparation counter / Bulk hot carts / Bulk cold carts
The kitchen layout below is characteristic of which foodservice system? Deck ovens / Range / Tilting skillet / Refrigerator / Freezer / Preparation counter / Meal assembly / Delivery carts
The kitchen layout below is characteristic of which foodservice system? Refrigerator / Freezer / Steamers / Ovens / Microwave / Meal assembly / Delivery carts
Which of the following has the quickest onset of food-borne illness?
The profitability of a coffee shop may be determined by calculating the ratio of profit to:
Dishes are greasy when unloaded from the dishmachine. What should you check first?
Which of the following strategies is most likely to increase revenue? Contribution margin Low High Sales Low Pot roast Beef tacos High Barbecued ribs Beef stew
Which method of buying includes contacting several vendors to obtain price quotes and placing orders?
To determine how profitable a department has been, determine the profit margin, which is:
A catered lunch is cancelled after the food has been prepared. What should you do?
choices: sell the meals in the cafeteria at a break-even price
incorporate the items into the next meal service

q: The raw food cost of an item is $1.12 per serving. What is the hidden cost?
Which would be a sentinel event?
choices: an NPO patient receiving a regular tray
a low sodium patient receiving a regular tray
a weight reduction patient receiving a regular tray
a high potassium patient receiving a regular tray

q: Which would be a sentinel event?
choices: a meat slicer left with the blade unguarded
a wet floor near the dishmachine

q: An employee consistently calls in sick the day before a holiday. His Supervisor should:
choices: telephone the employee to verify the illness
schedule a counseling session with him
file a letter of concern with the employee relations department

q: According to HACCP, which would be the recommendation when preparing spaghetti and sauce?
choices: divide the prepared sauce into several small pans before chilling
rinse spaghetti in cold water before mixing with sauce
cook the meat thoroughly before mixing with sauce
stir occasionally throughout the holding time

q: Primary considerations in the purchase of foodservice equipment are:
Which of the following is least valuable in a specification?
choices: count on container or number per pound
the unit on which price will be based

q: When a supervisor says to a subordinate, “Do it because I am asking you to; I’m the boss,” they are using what type of power?
Which of the following tools would be best in determining consumption of vegetables in a high school?
Cost-effectiveness analysis is used to:
choices: compare two or more alternatives to achieve the same objective
place a dollar amount on the outcome of the procedure

q: A manager asks for input and advice from several employees on a situation. He then makes a decision which may or may not reflect the input provided by the employees. He is using what leadership decision-making style?
The primary goal of outcomes research in a health care setting is to:
choices: improve the quality of services offered
give the facility a competitive advantage

q: The food service director who wants to hire a dietitian should first:
choices: publish a job listing in the Journal of the American Dietetic Assoc.
screen potential applicants to determine who has an RD credential
develop a job description and specification for the position

q: Which of the following is an outcome indicator?
choices: customers are satisfied with the meals
tube feeding bags and sets are changed every 24 hours
food allergies are documented in the medical record
